description: Blackberries are aggregate fruits similar to raspberries but with a solid core. They have a deep purple-black color and a sweet-tart flavor that becomes sweeter as they ripen.
season: Late summer to early fall (July-September in most regions)
storage_tips: Store unwashed in the refrigerator for 3-5 days. Handle gently to avoid crushing. For longer storage, freeze on a baking sheet, then transfer to freezer bags. Frozen blackberries work well for jams.
preparation: Wash gently just before using. Remove any stems or leaves. For jams, can be used whole or lightly crushed. The solid core makes them more robust than raspberries.
